intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris aestivalis, commonly known as the common velvetleaf, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is an annual herb that typically grows in disturbed soils and is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. The plant has alternate, pinnately divided leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that develop into spherical, hairy seed pods. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and the plant is often considered a weed in agricultural settings. The species is characterized by its rapid growth and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
